snippet: Measures that ban abortion 20 weeks after conception, on the disputed idea that the fetus can feel pain at that point, have spread by tapping into public concern about late-stage abortions.
abstract: Push to ban abortion at 20 weeks after conception, on theory that the fetus can feel pain at that point, has emerged as potent new tactic of anti-abortion movement; advocates saw potential of such a measure because it taps into public concern about late-stage abortions, appears to alter rules only incrementally, and claims to be rooted in science.
lead_paragraph: Measures that ban abortion 20 weeks after conception, on the disputed idea that the fetus can feel pain at that point, have spread by tapping into public concern about late-stage abortions.

headline.main: Theory on Pain Is Driving Rules for Abortions
headline.print_headline: Theory on Pain Is Driving Rules For Abortions
